Package org.e2immu.support

Class FirstThen<S,​T>

java.lang.Object
org.e2immu.support.FirstThen<S,​T>
Type Parameters:
S - type of the before state
T - type of the after or final state
public class FirstThen<S,​T> extends Object
An object which first holds an object of type S, and, in the second and final stage of its life-cycle, holds an object of type T.

This class is eventually level 2 immutable: once the second stage has been reached, its fields cannot be changed anymore.

This is an example class! Please extend and modify for your needs.

  • Method Details

    • isFirst

      public boolean isFirst()
      Test if the object is in the before state
      Returns:
      true when the object is in the before state

    • isSet

      public boolean isSet()
      Test if the object is in the after or final state
      Returns:
      true when the object is in the after state

    • set

      public void set​(T then)
      The method that sets the final value, discarding the initial one forever. The object transitions from mutable to immutable, from before to after.
      Parameters:
      then - the final value
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - when the final value is null
      IllegalStateException - when the object had already reached its final stage

    • getFirst

      public S getFirst()
      Getter for the initial value.
      Returns:
      The initial value
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when the object has already transitioned into the final stage

    • get

      public T get()
      Getter for the final value.
      Returns:
      The final value
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when the object has not yet transitioned into the final stage

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Object o)
      Delegating equals.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - the other value
      Returns:
      true when o is also a FirstThen object, with the same initial or final object object, as defined by the equals method on S or T respectively.

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Delegating hash code.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      a hash code based on the hash code of the initial or final value.
